page.title: 15TOURISM EGMANTON/LAXTON
page.content: The area attracts tourists because of its historical associations. Laxton's medieval field system is widely documented and it and the motte and bailey attract visitors, especially school parties. Egmanton has many sightseers admiring the Comper screen. Trips to Moorhouse church are arranged by the Southwell Minster Thoroton Society. Accommodation for tourists is provided by two farms at Laxton offering bed and breakfast. The English Tourist Board is encouraging people to the East Midlands and a 'Centre Parcs' holiday village at Rufford may increase interest in our own area.
